notesStmt.note: A few scrapes/delaminations on leather writing surface.
Substantial and deliberate fold between each text column.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

layoutDesc.layout: Columns: 20; ruled lines: 21; written lines: 21; Uniform layout. Ruling by hard point, membrane by membrane. Visible pricking. Hair side and flesh side of membranes distinguishable. Three tagin on שעטנזגץ and one on בדהחיק. The letter ח is arched throughout. A few majuscular or minuscular letters. The names of the sons of Haman arranged in 11 lines, in accordance with the rule. Ivory roller (308mm high). Roller handle has brass ferrule. Wooden core.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi square script of the 16th to 17th century.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Bequeathed to the British Museum by Rev. J. Noble Coleman on 25 May 1872.
